title: 'Ex-PM conveyed gratitude': Yasin Malik's major claim on meeting Hafiz Saeed; calls case 'betrayal'
content: Yasin Malik, jailed JKLF chief, claims he met with Lashkar-e-Taiba founder Hafiz Saeed in 2006 at the request of IB, as part of a backchannel peace process. Malik alleges that then Prime Minister Manmohan Singh expressed gratitude for his efforts.

title: 'Was fed up, wanted to take sanyas': Sheena Bora's childhood friend; email texts cited
content: Sheena Bora, allegedly murdered by Indrani Mukerjea, expressed a desire for 'sanyas' due to life's problems, according to a childhood friend's testimony, citing old emails. The friend, a prosecution witness, shared Bora's plans to marry Rahul Mukerjea and her strained relationship with Indrani. Communication ceased abruptly after a text about breaking up with Rahul.

title: Bengaluru civic apathy continues: Another school van gets stuck in open drain
content: In Bengaluru, a school minivan carrying children got stuck in an open drain on Panathur-Bellandur road, fortunately without injuries. This incident follows a series of accidents on the same stretch, including a school bus partially toppling and other vehicles sinking into slush-filled craters.

title: iPhone 17 Pro Max vs 16 Pro Max: Which version is better
content: Apple has reintroduced Aluminium frame design with the iPhone 17 Pro Max. While the iPhone 16 Pro Max was launched with Titanium body frame. Apple iPhone 17 Pro Max comes with a starting price of Rs 1,49,900 in India, which is Rs 5,000 more than the price of iPhone 16 Pro Max. But is it a good upgrade? Let's find out

title: Stabbed, stripped, extorted: Woman sexually harassed inside B'luru PG; accused arrested
content: A 37-year-old man allegedly stabbed and sexually harassed a 24-year-old woman at a PG in Bengaluru’s Whitefield, demanding money and transferring  Rs 14,000 from her account. He was later assaulted by PG staff, leading to cross-complaints. Police have arrested the accused, Sai Babu Chennuru, and registered cases of attempt to murder, sexual harassment, extortion, and assault.

title: Asia Cup: Timeline of handshake row - ICC pulls up PCB over PMOA violation
content: The Asia Cup 2025 is embroiled in controversy after India's refusal to shake hands with Pakistan sparked a major standoff. The PCB demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, delaying a match against the UAE. The ICC accused PCB of protocol breaches, including unauthorised recording within the PMOA.

title: Man throws chilli powder in his daughter’s eyes, later stabs her to death
content: In Gwalior's Janakganj, a shocking incident unfolded as Badam Singh Kushwaha allegedly murdered his 24-year-old daughter, Rani Kushwaha. Police reports indicate that Singh, fueled by a long-standing family dispute and alcohol addiction, attacked Rani with chili powder before fatally stabbing her. The mother stated that Rani often objected to his behavior.

title: Gemini achieves coding milestone; CEO Sundar Pichai celebrates; big leap
content: Google's Gemini 2.5 Deep Think achieved a gold-medal performance at the 2025 International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC) World Finals, solving 10 out of 12 problems. The AI tool even cracked a problem that no human team could solve, demonstrating a significant leap in abstract problem-solving. If ranked, Gemini would have secured 2nd place overall in the prestigious competition.

title: Zomato delivery boy attacked in Bengaluru over delayed food delivery
content: In Bengaluru's Bapuji Nagar, a Zomato delivery executive was reportedly assaulted by two individuals on September 14 due to a delayed food delivery. The dispute escalated when the order arrived late, resulting in the delivery boy sustaining minor injuries. Police are awaiting a formal complaint from the victim to initiate a full investigation into the incident.

title: Trump pressure: EU aims to phase out Russia LNG; reluctant to hit India, China with tariffs
content: The European Union is contemplating accelerating its timeline for phasing out Russian liquefied natural gas imports, potentially moving faster than the initially planned 2027 deadline. This consideration follows pressure from the US and is being explored through sanctions and modifications to the RePowerEU plan.

title: 48-hour deadline: Elon Musk to xAI staff; ‘Send me what you did, past four weeks too’
content: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: Muridke camp 'destroyed': After JeM, LeT commander makes big admission on Op Sindoor - Watch
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor, a Lashkar-e-Taiba commander admitted severe damage to their Muridke headquarters. This admission follows similar revelations from Jaish-e-Mohammed regarding their Bahawalpur base. LeT is now fundraising, allegedly under the guise of flood relief, to rebuild the destroyed Markaz-e-Taiba camp, with Pakistan allocating PKR 4 crore for the project.

title: Fact check: Are handshakes mandatory in cricket? What does the rulebook say?
content: Former international umpire Anil Chaudhary suggests that the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) recent controversies during the Asia Cup were a diversionary tactic following their loss to India. These controversies included boycott threats, disputes with ICC match referee Andy Pycroft, and a handshake disagreement with India, sparked by strained relations after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: DUSU 2025: Aryan Maan elected president; ABVP sweeps, NSUI trails
content: Delhi University’s 2025 DUSU elections concluded with ABVP’s Aryan Maan winning the President post, while the party secured three of the four key positions. Held on September 18 across 52 centres and 195 booths, the polls saw over 2.75 lakh eligible voters, with a 39.45% turnout. Key issues included campus safety, student welfare, and gender representation, reflecting the growing political engagement of Delhi University students.

title: Exclusive | Jaismine Lamboria's story: COVID, setbacks to World Champion!
content: Jaismine Lamboria, hailing from Bhiwani, overcame early setbacks, including a disappointing Olympic debut and health challenges, to clinch gold at the World Boxing Championships. Inspired by her family's boxing legacy, particularly her great-grandfather Hawa Singh, she shifted her focus to performance over results.

title: Pahalgam attack: NIA court extends custody by 45 days; DNA, mobile data reports awaited
content: A special NIA court in Jammu extended the custody of Bashir Ahmad Jothat and Parvaiz Ahmad by 45 days in connection with the Pahalgam terror attack. Arrested in June, they are accused of sheltering Pakistani militants involved in the April 22 attack.

title: Big blow! Trump revokes sanctions waiver - why is Iran’s Chabahar port important for India?
content: The US has revoked sanctions waivers for Chabahar port, impacting India's trade and strategic ambitions. This move affects India's operation of the Shahid Beheshti terminal, crucial for trade with Afghanistan and Central Asia, and a counter to China's Gwadar Port. The decision poses a setback to India's regional connectivity initiatives.

title: Mysuru Dasara row: SC junks plea over Banu Mushtaq invite; what it said
content: The Supreme Court has upheld the Karnataka high court's decision, allowing Muslim author Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate the state-sponsored Dasara Mahotsav at the Chamundeshwari Temple in Mysuru. The court dismissed an appeal arguing that the inauguration by a Muslim would hurt Hindu religious sentiments. The decision reinforces the secular nature of state events, as emphasized by the Constitution.

title: DUSU polls 2025: ABVP’s Aryan Maan elected president; NSUI's Rahul Jhansla becomes VP
content: Delhi University Student Union elections saw a calmer polling day with a slight increase in voter turnout, reaching 39.4%. While voting was largely peaceful, the NSUI accused ABVP of vote manipulation, alleging marked EVMs. ABVP refuted the claims, citing NSUI's frustration over their growing popularity. First-time voters expressed hopes for improved campus facilities and affordable transport.

title: Watch: PM Modi plants a Kadamb sapling; King Charles gifted it on his birthday
content: Narendra Modi received a Kadamb sapling from King Charles III. The gift marked Modi's 75th birthday. It also celebrated Modi's 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' initiative. Modi planted the sapling at his residence. Earlier, Modi gifted King Charles a Sonoma tree. The leaders discussed climate, trade, and wellness. The Kadamb tree symbolizes environmental responsibility. This act strengthens UK-India relations.

title: Slaps, punches and pushes: iPhone 17 frenzy turns violent at Mumbai Apple store
content: Enthusiasts in Mumbai and Delhi eagerly awaited the iPhone 17 series launch, causing long queues and a minor scuffle at the BKC Jio Centre. The new lineup, including the iPhone 17 Pro Max, boasts an A19 Bionic chip and enhanced cameras. Some customers, like Irfan, waited overnight for specific models, while others expressed concerns about security amidst the chaos.

title: ‘Mahavatar Narsimha’ OTT release: When and where to watch; blockbuster mythological movie
content: Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha,' a high-grossing animated film rooted in Indian mythology, is set to stream on Netflix. The film, based on the Vishnupurana and other Puranas, tells the story of Bhakta Prahlad and Lord Vishnu's Narsimha avatar.

title: DUSU 2025: Who wins? Track the last 10 presidential races
content: The DUSU Elections 2025 are witnessing a close contest between ABVP and NSUI as vote counting continues at Delhi University. Early trends show ABVP slightly ahead in key posts, with presidential candidate Aryan Maan leading. With the last decade dominated by ABVP except two NSUI wins, today’s outcome will decide whether ABVP extends its stronghold or NSUI stages a comeback.

title: Ahead of call with Xi, Trump says 'very close' to trade deal
content: President Trump is scheduled to speak with Xi Jinping to advance trade discussions and address the TikTok situation, aiming to finalize a deal involving American investors. Despite past accusations of conspiracy, Trump maintains a positive relationship with China. The leaders will also seek common ground on tariffs, as a temporary tariff-reduction deal is set to expire in November.

title: Brenner Tunnel: How Europe’s longest rail project will reshape connectivity between Italy, Austria
content: The Brenner Base Tunnel, the world's longest underground rail tunnel, has achieved a breakthrough, connecting Italy and Austria. This project aims to alleviate congestion and pollution on the Alpine corridor by shifting freight from road to rail. Travel times will be significantly reduced, fostering a greener, better-connected Europe despite facing delays and cost overruns.

title: 'Though I am Muslim, I love this Bhagwa iPhone 17': Delhi man rejoices; cosmic orange in spotlight
content: The iPhone 17 series launch in India sparked excitement, particularly for the new 'Cosmic Orange' edition, likened to saffron. Long queues formed at Apple stores in Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru as buyers eagerly sought the new devices. The orange variant is gaining popularity, with some customers seeing it as a symbol of Indian tradition.

title: Stefon Diggs Sighted: From hospital exit to rumors swirling; Cardi B pregnancy timeline questioned
content: Stefon Diggs was seen leaving a New York hospital with a baby carrier. This happened before his public appearance with rapper Cardi B. The couple later announced they are expecting a child. Diggs is also facing a paternity suit from model Aileen Lopera. She claims he is the father of her baby born in April.

title: Handshake row: ICC sends strong email to PCB; claims violations in PMOA
content: It remains to be seen how the PCB responds to the strongly-worded email, as they are yet to furnish details in response to another email sent by the global cricket body to the PCB on September 17 — the day the drama unfolded and the fixture, against the UAE, was delayed by an hour.

title: Want to join garba in MP? Perform aarti, apply tilak, gulp Gangajal
content: Amidst growing calls to bar non-Hindus from Navratri garba events in Madhya Pradesh, BJP leaders have proposed controversial measures. These include mandatory tilak application, Gangajal consumption, and participation in aarti for non-Hindus. Suggestions involve monitoring venues with cameras and ID checks, with one MLA stating that misbehavior could lead to demolition of homes.

title: Tamil Nadu: Woman pours boiling oil on husband over job dispute
content: In Cuddalore, a 30-year-old woman, K Divya Bharathi, was arrested for allegedly pouring boiling oil on her husband, C Kannan, after he forbade her from working. The incident occurred following frequent quarrels over Kannan's objection to his wife's desire to work in a rice mill. Kannan sustained burn injuries and is currently receiving treatment at a government hospital.

title: ‘UK PM was embarrassed’: Trump says Starmer supports his call to ban Russian oil
content: Donald Trump claimed the UK Prime Minister privately supported his criticism of NATO and EU countries for buying Russian energy, viewing it as a barrier to peace in Ukraine. Trump stated the UK PM agreed to consider sanctions and halt Russian oil purchases. These remarks highlight ongoing tensions over Europe's energy dependence and its impact on resolving the conflict.

title: 'If they put sanctions on China ...': Trump asked about UK PM & Russian oil
content: Donald Trump is advocating for Europe to impose sanctions on China, believing it would halt the Ukraine war due to China's significant purchase of Russian oil. He highlighted his administration's tariff measures, including a 50% tariff on India. Despite his previous hopes and efforts to mediate, Trump expressed disappointment with Vladimir Putin's failure to deliver a peaceful resolution.

title: UGC’s UG math curriculum draft: Experts flag ‘grave defects’; here's why
content: The UGC’s draft undergraduate mathematics curriculum, unveiled under NEP 2020, has drawn fierce criticism from over 900 experts, including Padma awardees and Bhatnagar laureates. Petitioners flag “grave defects,” citing sidelining of core subjects, exclusion of applied mathematics, outdated inclusions, and bizarre references. They demand withdrawal and redrafting by qualified mathematicians to safeguard India’s scientific and educational standards.

title: Big boost: India, UAE aim to double bilateral non-oil trade to $100 bn; check details
content: India and the UAE aim to double non-oil, non-precious metal trade to $100 billion in 3-4 years, driven by the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement. Bilateral non-oil trade reached nearly $38 billion in the first half of 2025, a 34% increase from 2024.

title: Bullets rain on Gurgaon builder’s office: Jaguar, BMW riddled with shots
content: In Gurgaon's Sector 45, unidentified assailants fired over 25 rounds at the MNR Buildmark office on Thursday night, causing panic in the neighborhood. The brazen attack, which damaged two luxury cars, occurred near the Sector 40 police station, raising concerns about security. Fortunately, no casualties were reported, and police are investigating the incident, complicated by non-functional CCTV cameras.

title: Kershaw to retire after season: 'The right time'
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: Now 0-3, Dolphins battle but refuse moral victories
content: The Dolphins played the heavily favored Bills tough Thursday night but didn't take any pride in losing 31-21.

title: Witness in 2006 Miami murder case found alive
content: It's unclear how the revelation about witness Paul Conner will affect the murder trial of Rashaun Jones, currently set to start Oct. 6.

title: NFL: Officiate tush push 'tight' after missed call
content: The NFL said the Eagles should have been flagged for at least one false start when they used the tush push against the Chiefs on Sunday and instructed officials this week to call the controversial play "tight."

title: 'We believed it': Fever end playoff series drought
content: The Indiana Fever beat the Atlanta Dream 87-85 to advance to the WNBA semifinals and win their first playoff series since 2015.

title: Sources: ACC closing in on new schedule format
content: ACC athletics directors are scheduled to meet Monday in Charlotte to discuss the details of what will either be a move to a nine-game conference slate with one additional Power 4 game required or an "8+2" model.

title: Agent: Kuminga prepared to take qualifying offer
content: Jonathan Kuminga's agent told ESPN that Kuminga -- who is seeking a player option -- is prepared to take the $7.9 million qualifying offer unless the Golden State Warriors improve their current offers.

title: Source: Packers' Kraft 'all good' after injury scare
content: Green Bay Packers standout tight end Tucker Kraft, who sustained a knee injury during practice Thursday, got "a little scare but all good," a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter after tests Thursday.

title: 🍿 Young, Beverley trade words over All-Star effort
content: The exchange between the Atlanta Hawks guard and 12-year NBA pro intensified Wednesday, capped off by a post from the Hawks on Thursday.

title: WWE Wrestlepalooza preview: Cena-Lesnar to kick off ESPN's first Premium Live Event
content: We break down the major Wrestlepalooza storylines, including John Cena vs. Brock Lesnar and the return of AJ Lee.

title: Wetzel: WNBA's gold rush leaves Connecticut fans in the dust
content: The WNBA is repaying Connecticut fans for their loyalty by trying to move the Sun out of state, ESPN's Dan Wetzel writes.

title: How a Dodgers reliever became the unlikely catalyst for baseball's biggest labor battle
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: How do top wrestlers throw down?
content: In professional wrestling, your signature moves create a foundation for success. Learn more how John Cena, Becky Lynch and other stars perform now.

title: Which 0-2 teams still have a shot at the playoffs? Barnwell ranks all 10 by turnaround likelihood
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: With Haaland and Guardiola, Manchester City can never be counted out in the Champions League
content: Don't tell Pep Guardiola the odds -- as Erling Haaland & Co. showed vs. Napoli, Manchester City are still a threat to win the Champions League.

title: Rashford's brilliant first goals for Barcelona prove Man United exit doesn't define him
content: Marcus Rashford was tasked with proving himself in England. He did that, scoring twice to lift Barcelona.

title: Week 4 kickoff: Arch Manning leads list of QBs falling short, plus breakout players and top quotes
content: Ahead of Week 4, we take a look at big conference matchups, quarterbacks who have room to grow, plus quotes.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 3
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Early observations: Is Smith-Njigba a WR1? What to do with Henderson and Loveland?
content: Takeaways on more than a dozen players, including whether you should be patient with a pair of rookies.

title: 'They're done building around him': Inside the tumultuous Kawhi Leonard era in Los Angeles
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: Why the champs and four other teams control the future of the NBA draft
content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team ranks with less than two weeks left
content: Some teams have already clinched postseason berths, while others are making one last push with 11 days to go. Where do they all stand on our second-to-last list?

title: The race for the USMNT's No. 9 shirt is wide open
content: Striker has long been a problem area for the U.S. men's national team. Now, though, the Americans boast four forwards at the top of their game.

title: Will Gladbach's instability prove to be a blessing or a curse for Reyna?
content: Gio Reyna moved to Borussia Monchengladbach to help revive his career. The team already has a new coach.

title: No run game in Kansas City? Poor O-lines in Houston, Minnesota? Real-or-not ratings for every team
content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size?

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: Can the Giants afford to sit Jaxson Dart for the whole year? Here are the benefits
content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

title: What happens to a college football roster when a coach is fired in September?
content: UCLA and Virginia Tech fired their coaches Sunday after Week 3 of the college football season. What's next?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Atlético, Barça eye Vlahovic
content: Manchester United, Atlético Madrid and Barcelona are keeping tabs on Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Way-Too-Early Grand Slam predictions for 2026
content: The majors are done for the year -- is it too early to forecast who will reign supreme in 2026? Never.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Scattered showers to continue over T.N. until September 21
content: A gradual dip in rainfall, which may be confined to one or two places, is expected over the State from September 22, 2025

title: Two from India win 2025 Ig Nobel prize for engineering design
content: Vikash Kumar and Sarthak Mittal were feted ‘for analysing, from an engineering design perspective, how foul-smelling shoes affect the good experience of using a shoe-rack’

title: Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala accuses Kerala CM of misleading Assembly on police dismissals
content: Chennithala says people who go to police stations in Kerala ‘have to return with cotton in their noses’

title: Pahalgam attack: Special court extends period of probe, accused's custody
content: The court held a prima facie case in favour of the extension of the remand and the investigation in view of the allegations, progress of investigation and pending forensic and DNA profiling reports

title: Allahabad HC grants bail to Mukhtar Ansari's son in forgery case
content: He was accused of using fake documents and the forged signature of his mother Afsa Ansari to get a property released in his favour

title: Rahul Gandhi systematically, deliberately trying to weaken democracy, says Ravi Shankar Prasad
content: Former Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad dismissed the claims of the Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha

title: Industrial Park likely to come up in the land allocated to Reliance Group in Nellore
content: The 7000 acres land parcel allotted to the Reliance Group for establishing a power plant has been kept idle for the last 18 years, former minister asks in the Assembly

title: K.C. Venugopal flays Kerala govt for ‘politicising’ Lord Ayyappa
content: In a letter to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, Venugopal says organising Global Ayyappa Sangamam in the name of protecting faith was ‘nothing but hypocrisy’ on the part of the government

title: Continued need to probe ‘Modani Scam’ in all dimensions: Congress on SEBI clean chit to Adani
content: Jairam Ramesh also shared a set of questions the party had posed in the 100-question-series "Hum Adani Ke Hain Kaun" (HAHK), and said they remain unanswered

title: ECI and CEO Karnataka trying to mislead people on Aland probe: Priyank Kharge
content: The Hindu was the first to report on how the investigation into attempts to delete 5,994 voters from the rolls in Aland using forged Form 7 had gone cold with the ECI not sharing key technical data

title: Malla Jagadiswara Rao to represent BMS at international conference in Colombo
content: Representatives of various nations in Asia and the Pacific region, officials of Ministry of Labour and Employment, and representatives of managements would participate

title: Kerala Assembly flags perils of using ‘paper cups’ as substitute for plastic food containers
content: Perils posed by growing use of misleadingly named ‘paper cups’ containing microplastics and toxic inner coatings highlighted

title: Tribunals uphold ban on two J&K groups, including Mirwaiz Farooq's Awami Action Committee
content: On March 11, the Union Home Ministry banned the two groups and said that the AAC and the JKIM were indulging in unlawful activities that were prejudicial to the integrity, sovereignty and security of India

title: Five Bangladeshi nationals detained in Tripura to be sent back to their country
content: The officer said the detained Bangladesh nationals claimed that they had entered Indian soil a few days ago and were engaged in construction and furniture work

title: Chief Justice of Australia Stephen Gageler visits Supreme Court, shares dais with CJI Gavai
content: The CJI welcomed the Australian counterpart and introduced him to lawyers and litigants in the courtroom where he was sharing the dias with Justices Vinod Chandran and N.V. Anjaria

title: Advertisements set to return on Namma Metro pillars in Bengaluru, BMRCL eyes major boost in non-fare revenue
content: BMRCL estimates that allowing advertisements outside metro station premises could increase its non-fare box revenue by ₹60crore to ₹80 crore a year

title: Ruckus in Odisha Assembly over fertiliser crisis, House adjourned till 4 p.m.
content: The House could function for only four minutes, with Speaker Surama Padhy adjourning the proceedings till 4 pm as her repeated requests to the agitating members to return to their seats fell on deaf ears

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain Telugu poet Varavara Rao's plea seeking modification of bail condition in Elgar Parishad case
content: "Government will take care of his health or go to the same court. We are not interested," the Bench said

title: V.D. Satheesan says ‘no official’ Opposition boycott of Global Ayyappa Sanghamam in Kerala
content: Satheesan says Opposition has instead ‘merely questioned the government’s moral correctness’ in sponsoring such an event in the name of Ayyappa

title: Kerala Opposition Leader denies role in cyberattacks on woman CPI(M) leader K.J. Shine
content: Satheesan says defamatory campaign could be an ‘insider job’, given the ‘intense factional feuding’ in CPI(M) in Ernakulam district

title: Congress must be realistic, RJD accommodative in seat-sharing talks for Bihar polls: Dipankar Bhattacharya
content: The Left party's general secretary made it clear that there was "no ambiguity" over RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav being the bloc's chief ministerial face if the Grand Alliance came to power

title: Bombay HC receives second bomb threat email in week; turns out to be hoax
content: An email about a bomb blast in the court premises in south Mumbai was received on the official ID early in the morning

title: ‘Look to the Preamble’, Supreme Court replies to plea against Banu Mushtaq inaugurating Mysuru Dasara
content: The Karnataka High Court had earlier dismissed batch of petitions, including one by Mr. Gaurav, against the invite to Ms. Mushtaq

title: Policy initiatives being taken for space, cyber warfare equipment development: CDS Gen. Anil Chauhan in Ranchi
content: Gen. Chauhan said that although the indigenisation of defence manufacturing started late in India but the country is on the right track

title: Patanjali challenges HC order restraining it from airing 'disparaging' ads against Dabur Chyawanprash
content: The court warned Patanjali that in case it finds it to be a luxury litigation and a useless appeal, it will impose costs

title: S.P. Velumani case: Sanction to prosecute IAS officers delayed over translation of documents, DVAC tells Madras HC
content: Appearing before Justice N. Anand Venkatesh, APP Raj Thilak says since 2024, the Centre has been insisting on the submission of translated documents

title: Jharkhand, endowed with uranium, can contribute to nuclear weapon manufacturing: CM Soren
content: Soren said his Government is ready to fully cooperate with the Centre to make the defence sector self-reliant

title: Kerala Opposition backs unanimous Assembly resolution against special intensive revision in State
content: Leader of Opposition V.D. Satheesan questions ECI’s rationale of holding SIR in the short run-up to local body polls and Assembly elections in 2026 in Kerala

title: Privatisation of medical colleges: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Council adjourned amid YSRCP protests
content: Council Chairman K. Moshen Raju urged the protesting members to maintain order, assuring them that their demand would be placed before the BAC meeting

title: Kerala Assembly: Opposition walks out after Speaker disallows debate on Sabarimala temple gold row
content: Speaker A.N. Shamseer says the matter is sub judice and Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business precludes the Assembly from considering issues within the judiciary’s purview

title: Supreme Court to hear on September 26 plea of Vodafone Idea Ltd. for quashing additional AGR demand
content: The Supreme Court in September 2020 fixed a time frame of 10 years for telecom service providers struggling to pay ₹93,520 crore of AGR related dues to clear their outstanding amount to the Government

title: Delhi riots case: Supreme Court adjourns bail pleas of Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and others to September 22
content: The pleas challenge a September 2 verdict of the High Court which had held that the accused played “prima facie grave” roles in a “premeditated conspiracy”

title: Maharashtra Government makes e-KYC mandatory for Ladki Bahin beneficiaries; sets two-month deadline
content: The Scheme provides monthly assistance of ₹1,500 to women in the age group of 21-65, whose annual family income is not more than ₹2.5 lakh

title: Telangana’s rural women redefine ambition, drive change and prosperity
content: Women self-help groups seem to be rewriting the rules of rural enterprise. From running kirana shops and small canteens to managing fuel stations and leasing buses to the State-run road transport corporation, they are scaling ambitious heights under the Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty. With solar power units on the horizon, these women from economically disadvantaged backgrounds are now earning profits, respect and breaking deep-rooted patriarchal barriers, writes P. Laxma Reddy

title: ‘Chunaav ka chaukidar’ protected ‘vote chors’: Rahul’s dig at ECI
content: Rahul Gandhi’s remarks came a day after he ramped up his attack on the issue of vote theft, accusing Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar of protecting those who “destroyed democracy

title: Why were ST certificates issued to members of Malayali community in Erode district, Madras HC asks T.N.
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan call for an explanation by October 23, 2025

title: "I Only Got 4": Gujarat Woman Blocks Road After Fight With Golgappa Seller
content: In most cities, traffic is disrupted by processions, political rallies, or the occasional monsoon downpour. In Gujarat's Vadodara this week, the culprit was golgappas, the popular street food.

title: Meet Robin, Robot That Acts Like 7-Year-Old To Help Patients In Hospitals
content: Days after Meagan Brazil-Sheehans 6-year-old son was diagnosed with leukemia, they were walking down the halls of UMass Memorial Childrens Medical Center when they ran into Robin the Robot.

title: West Bengal Gears Up For Voter Roll Revision, 2026 Poll Preparation Begins
content: The Office of the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) in West Bengal has begun preparations for the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral roll, scheduled to begin after Lakshmi Puja on October 6, according to sources.

title: Taliban Bans Books Written By Women In Afghan Universities, 18 Courses Dropped
content: A total of 679 textbooks, including 140 written by women and 310 by Iranian authors or publishers, have been prohibited.

title: From 'Felt At Home In Pakistan' To ''84 Mein Hua To Hua,': Sam Pitroda's 7 Remarks That Created Controversies
content: Congress leader Sam Pitroda is once again under fire for his remarks after he urged the Centre to prioritise dialogue with neighbouring countries and said that India's foreign policy should begin by strengthening ties with Pakistan

title: US To Revoke Sanctions Waiver For Iran's Chabahar Port. Will It Affect India?
content: In yet another tough move against India, the Donald Trump administration in the United States has announced the revocation of its waiver of sanctions over the strategic Iranian port of Chabahar, granted in 2018.

title: High Drama Outside Odisha Assembly After Woman Attempts To Gatecrash
content: A high-drama protest unfolded outside the Odisha Legislative Assembly on Friday when a woman from Jajpur attempted to storm the premises with a set of demands.

title: Macron Forced To Prove His Wife Is Not A Man: How This Bizarre Case Began
content: The Macrons in France are fighting a bizarre 'gender conspiracy' against the country's First Lady, Brigette Macron, with President Emmanuel Macron being forced to "prove" that his wife is not a transgender woman.

title: PM Modi Plants Kadamb Sapling Gifted By King Charles At His Residence
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday planted a Kadamb sapling at his official residence, 7 Lok Kalyan Marg. Interestingly, this Kadamb sapling was given to him by King Charles III of the United Kingdom as a birthday gift on turning 75 on September

title: Engine Starts After Breakfast: Oil Kumar Swaps Meals For Motor Oil
content: A Karnataka man has captured public attention for his highly unusual dietary habits. 'Oil Kumar' from the Shivamogga district allegedly drinks tea and nearly seven to eight litres of engine oil daily.

title: Despite Tin-Shed Structures, Schools Performing Well: Delhi Government To High Court
content: The Delhi government on Wednesday defended the condition of several government schools functioning under tin sheds.

title: After 'Gen Z' Stir In Nepal, Fury Over 'Nepo Babies' In Philippines
content: Weeks of heavy monsoon rains have flooded much of the Philippines, showing how vulnerable low-lying towns are, and triggering deep public anger over corruption and the flashy lifestyles of the wealthy.

title: ISRO To Launch Half-Humanoid Vyommitra On Gaganyaan Mission In December
content: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chief V. Narayanan, interacting with the media on Thursday in Coimbatore, mentioned that a half-humanoid called Vyommitra, instead of a human being, will be sent this December.

title: Overnight Rain Leaves Bengaluru Waterlogged, More Showers Predicted
content: Heavy overnight rains battered Bengaluru, bringing the city to a standstill on Friday with waterlogging in several low-lying areas and traffic snarls on key stretches.

title: Jharkhand Government Reshuffles IPS Cadre, Transfers 30 Officers
content: The Jharkhand government effected a major reshuffle of its IPS cadre, transferring and giving new appointments to 30 officers, a notification said.

title: Adani Power Shares Jump 29% On Morgan Stanley's 'Overweight' Call
content: Shares of Adani Power Ltd (APL) surged in the morning trade on Friday after global brokerage Morgan Stanley initiated 'Overweight' on the company with a target price of Rs 818, projecting an upside of 29 per cent from its previous closing price.

title: FBI Tip Helps Thwart Potential School Shooting At High School In New York
content: A swift joint operation by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the New York Police Department (NYPD) thwarted a potential school shooting at Benjamin Cardozo High School in Queens in New York

title: Durga Idol's Face Stolen In Bengal, Accused Tied To Pole And Thrashed
content: The faces of two Durga idols were allegedly stolen from a workshop of sculptor Bapi Pal and recovered from a nearby workshop of Pritam Thakur.

title: Not Like Venus Or Mars, Distant Exoplanet May Have Atmosphere Like Earth's
content: A distant exoplanet might have an atmosphere similar to Earth's, early observations from the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) suggest. It is part of a group of planets orbiting a star called TRAPPIST-1, about 40 light-years away from Earth.

title: Decision on caste census only after consulting CM Siddaramaiah: Shivakumar
content: According to sources, during the cabinet meeting the caste census issue came up for discussion, during which several Ministers expressed objections and reservations regarding the caste list and “problematic nomenclatures” of castes mentioned in it

title: Youth Congress workers stage black flag protest against Kerala CM in Kovalam
content: CM arrives at Kovalam to inaugurate Kerala-European Union Blue Economy Conclave. Police arrest at least five Youth Congress activists. Youth Congress has called for Statewide protests against Kerala government, accusing it of using the police to target Opposition workers

title: Conduct of Legislative business Speaker’s prerogative; Jagan violated Constitution: Former Minister Yanamala
content: Yanamala advised the former CM to recall how many times the TDP MLAs were denied the opportunity to speak in 2019-24

title: Rahul Gandhi, Sonia in Wayanad for All India Congress Committee meeting with KPCC president Sunny Joseph
content: Rahul Gandhi’s engagement with senior party leaders is widely interpreted as a signal to the rank and file of the party that the Congress high command remains committed to addressing escalating local bickering

title: Bengaluru is home, BlackBuck is only relocating within city, says co-founder & CEO
content: BlackBuck’s co-founder & CEO Rajesh Yabaji said that the company has decided to move out of its current location at Bellandur on Bengaluru’s Outer Ring Road (ORR), citing commuting and road infrastructure issues.

title: Actor-Mandi MP faces 'Go back Kangana, you are late' slogan during visit to Himachal's rain-affected area
content: Heated arguments were also witnessed when BJP leaders and others accompanying Kangana tried to pacify the residents, and police had to intervene to restore peace.

title: Kerala Minister V. Sivankutty taken to hospital after experiencing dizziness in Assembly
content: Sivankutty’s office says Minister is stable and hopes to return to Assembly at the earliest after routine checks

title: Nalanda is living idea of knowledge without boundaries: NU V-C
content: The visiting scholars, leaders and policy experts reflected on “Nalanda’s timeless legacy and the urgent call for climate action”

title: Workshop and panel discussion on hydrogen fuel technologies and future trends in Bengaluru
content: Priestly B. Shan, Vice-Chancellor, Alliance University, said that ‘one of the key opportunities in India’s hydrogen transition was its potential to create large-scale employment. The National Green Hydrogen Mission estimates 6 lakh new jobs by 2030’

title: 17-year-old narrowly escapes wild elephant attack in Aralam rehabilitation area in Kerala
content: The student was on his way to the institute when he encountered the elephant. He managed to escape by running into a nearby house

title: Rahul Gandhi’s vote theft charges ‘baseless’: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde
content: In a jibe, the Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister said the Congress leader had intended to "drop a hydrogen bomb" during his press conference but had forgotten to do so.

title: Assam’s BTR maintains students’ health, academic history
content: The One-Student-One File Mission launched for 1,163 children across 10 schools in the Bodoland Territorial Region also entails documenting a child’s psychological growth and performance in extracurricular activities

title: Students stage protest in Dharwad seeking requisite amenities in hostels in Karnataka
content: Seeking basic amenities in government-run hostels, increasing food allowance and filling up vacant posts of hostel staff and posts in residential schools, scores of students took out protest march and staged a demonstration in Dharwad on September 18

title: Rayaleesama youth ‘continue to chase the high’ despite measures
content: Many aged between 17 and 30 are trapped in the grip of addiction; latest measures targeting ganja smuggling, sale, and consumption, failed to control the deep-rooted tradition of intoxication, dating back to the British colonial period, in the Rayalaseema districts. A mistaken belief is that a single ‘roll of joint with ganja’ is equal to three-quarters of rum.

title: Revised GST rates from September 22 has a West Bengal influence, says Union Finance Minister
content: The Union Finance Minister also highlighted that GST rates have been reduced from 12 % to 5 % number of local produce and handicrafts of West Bengal which will boost the economy of the State

title: Operation Sindoor heralded new kind of warfare: CDS Anil Chauhan
content: “One of the matrices of victory over here is the sophistication of our attack, which was demonstrated there... Precision strikes for long-distance targets during the night required special efforts,” General Chauhan said

title: Kavitha’s resignation is still pending with me: Legislative Council Chairman Gutta Sukhender Reddy
content: Sukender Reddy said he spoke to Ms Kavitha over the phone and asked her to reconsider the decision as it was taken in an emotional state

title: Guinness record, carnival, floral holi to be part of Bathukamma festivities this year
content: With a keen eye on tourism promotion, the government has lined up several initiatives between September 21 and 30, which includes a grand floral parade and a ‘Bathukamma Carnival’

title: One killed, four injured in blast at chemical factory in Palghar
content: The local police are probing the incident, and an offence is likely to be registered after the authorities file a report, officials said

title: Liquor 'scam': Chhattisgarh ACB/EOW arrests retired IAS officer Niranjan Das
content: Mr. Das allegedly received undue benefits worth crores of rupees in return for the sale of unaccounted liquor in State-run liquor shops, transfer of officers, manipulation of tender process

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: SC adjourns bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid and others to September 22
content: A Delhi High Court Bench had dismissed the bail pleas of the nine accused, holding that their roles in the conspiracy  appeared “prima facie grave”

title: Donald Trump says he is ‘very close’ to India, PM Modi
content: “We have a very good relationship, and he put out a beautiful statement too. But I sanctioned them,” the U.S. President said

title: Telangana man ‘shot dead’ by police in U.S., family requests MEA to help in bringing back mortal remains
content: Mohammed Nizamuddin’s father has requested External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar to help in bringing his son’s mortal remains back to Mahabubnagar

title: Rains LIVE: Himachal monsoon death toll at 424,at least 45 still missing; 5 more bodies found in Uttarakhand’s Chamoli
content: As heavy overnight rains battered Bengaluru, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a ‘yellow alert’ for the city on Friday (September 19, 2025).

title: Ban on single-use plastic remains a flimsy promise in Karnataka
content: Though Karnataka was the first State in India to pass a law against the use of single-use plastics, it continues to thrive in the face of poor enforcement and civic apathy.

title: Why Gen Z is taking to the streets | In the U.S., Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and now, Nepal
content: Across the world, young people are protesting — against corrupt governments, growing inequality and a lack of opportunities. But can these mass movements, which often begin on social media platforms, bring lasting change?

title: Opposition, ruling parties spar over Rahul's fresh 'vote chori' charges, Congress seeks Fadnavis' resignation
content: “Names often go missing from voter lists, and this had happened when the Congress was in power too. This problem did not arise during the current government,” Ramdas Athavle said

title: DRI Patna apprehends two suspects involved in wildlife trafficking
content: The criminal syndicates involved in the poaching and illicit trade of leopard skin and “Hatha Jodi”, the reproductive organ of the protected monitor lizard

title: Chaos in Hyderabad markets over rollout of new GST prices
content: With just days to go for the new rates, retailers remain unsure how to bill the old stock even as the GST Department warns strict action for non-compliance from September 22

title: Agenda for sustainable bamboo economy set at Assam conclave
content: The focus is on integrating traditional knowledge with modern technology and leveraging market-driven approaches

title: Supreme Court makes interim bail granted to MLA Jegan Moorthy absolute
content: The case relates to the alleged abduction of a boy, aged over 16, from Kalambakkam near Thiruvalangadu on May 10

title: Sex workers in Kolkata’s Sonagachi | Only rights can stop the wrongs, says DMSC community
content: Durbar Mahila Samanwaya Committee, a collective of sex workers, turns 30; the community talks about their lives, difficult working conditions, their long-sought demand to be recognised as workers in Kolkata

title: West Bengal CM composes theme song for Durga Puja committee
content: During a meeting at the State Cabinet, the Chief Minister directed Ministers to keep a watch on their constituencies during the Durga Puja festival

title: Indian-origin U.S. woman killed in Punjab at behest of NRI man she planned to marry
content: U.S. citizen of Indian origin murdered in Ludhiana by U.K.-based NRI, Sukhjeet Singh, over marriage refusal, said the police

title: PM Modi to open expanded facilities at Tripura Sundari Temple
content: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha inspected arrangements at Udaipur and official said the development project aims to boost religious tourism

title: Lalit Modi’s brother, held in 2019 rape case; lawyer claims false case to extort money
content: The woman alleged that Samir Modi continuously harassed, assaulted and blackmailed her under false promises of marriage despite knowing he was already married, the police said

title: Supreme Court fines PWD ₹5 lakh for using workers to clean sewers outside court
content: Amicus curiae, submitted that the incident reflected a blatant disregard of binding directions. He pointed out that video footage showed a minor among those deployed for the hazardous task

title: CBI charges Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in ₹2,796-crore corruption case

title: Congress, BJP leaders spar over special intensive revision
content:
Congress and other parties raise concerns over SIR, citing impracticalities;
BJP welcomes the move, accuses Congress of double standards on electoral rolls

title: Modi-Xi meet repaired India-China relations, but its importance should not be overstated: experts
content: The experts were speaking at the launch of the book China: Indian Perspectives on China’s Politics, Economy, and Foreign Relations, a special publication by The Hindu Group

title: Some districts in north Tamil Nadu to receive heavy rain today
content: With the Southwest monsoon remaining active, rainfall occurred at many places in the State, including Chennai and neighbouring districts. Puducherry and Karaikal also saw widespread rain

title: Passengers escape unhurt after omnibus catches fire on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Vellore
content: All the passengers, including 10 women, were rescued. One of them was shifted to the Government Taluk Hospital in Gudiyatham for treatment

title: Protesters rally over alleged introduction of quota for non-SC/ST students in government hostels in U.P.
content: People of General and Other Backward Classes are being allocated seats in these hostels, which is in complete violation of norms, SC students wrote to the U.P. CM

title: Bills prevail in close win against Dolphins
